text: Balances of deceit \add are\add* an abomination of Yahweh,
but ⸤an accurate weight⸥\f + \fr 11:1 \ft Literally “a full stone” or “a pure stone” \f* delights him.
Pride comes, then disgrace comes,
but wisdom \add is\add* with the humble.
The integrity of the upright guides them,
but the crookedness of the treacherous destroys them.
Wealth does not profit on the day of wrath,
but righteousness will deliver from death.
The righteousness of the blameless will keep his ways straight,
but the wicked will fall by his wickedness.
The righteousness of the upright will save them,
but by a scheme the treacherous will be taken captive.
With the death of a wicked person, hope will die,
and the expectation of the godless perishes.
The righteous is delivered from trouble,
but the wicked enters into it.
With a mouth, the godless shall destroy his neighbor,
but by knowledge the righteous are delivered.
When good \add is with\add* the righteous, \add the\add* city rejoices,
and with the perishing of the wicked, jubilation.
By the blessing of the upright, a city will be exalted,
but by the mouth of the wicked, it will be overthrown.
He who lacks ⸤sense⸥\f + \fr 11:12 \ft Literally “heart” \f* belittles his neighbor,
but a person of intelligence will remain silent.
A gossip walks \add about\add* telling a secret,
but the trustworthy in spirit keeps \add the\add* matter.
Where there is no guidance, a nation\f + \fr 11:14 \ft Or “people” \f* shall fall,
but \add there is\add* safety in an abundance of counsel.
He will suffer trouble when he loans to a stranger,
but he who refuses a pledge is safe.
A woman of grace receives honor,
but the ruthless gets wealth.
A person of kindness rewards himself,\f + \fr 11:17 \ft Or “soul,” or “inner self” \f*
but a cruel \add person\add* harms his own flesh.
The wicked earns\f + \fr 11:18 \ft Or “does, makes” \f* ⸤deceptive gain⸥,\f + \fr 11:18 \ft Literally “gain of deception” \f*
but he who sows righteousness, a ⸤true reward⸥.\f + \fr 11:18 \ft Literally “a reward of truth” \f*
He who is steadfast in righteousness \add is\add* to life
as\f + \fr 11:19 \ft Hebrew “and” \f* he who pursues evil \add is\add* to death.
An abomination of Yahweh \add are\add* the ⸤crooked of heart⸥,\f + \fr 11:20 \ft Literally “crooked ones of heart”; “heart” may also be translated “mind” \f*
but his delight \add are\add* ⸤those with blameless ways⸥.\f + \fr 11:20 \ft Literally “blameless ones of ways” \f*
⸤Rest assured⸥,\f + \fr 11:21 \ft Literally “Hand to hand” \f* the wicked will not go unpunished,
but the offspring\f + \fr 11:21 \ft Or “seed” \f* of the righteous will escape.
A ring of gold in \add the\add* snout of a pig
\add is\add* a woman \add who is\add* beautiful but without discretion.
The desire of the righteous \add is\add* only good,
but the expectation of the wicked, wrath.
There is one who gives yet ⸤grows richer⸥,\f + \fr 11:24 \ft Literally “adding more” \f*
but he who withholds ⸤what is right⸥\f + \fr 11:24 \ft Literally “from what is right” \f* only \add finds\add* need.
A person of blessing will be enriched,
and he who gives water also will be refreshed.
He who withholds grain, the people curse him,
but a blessing \add is\add* for the head of him who sells.
He who diligently seeks good seeks favor,
but he who inquires of evil, it will come to him.
He who trusts in his wealth \add is\add* he who will fall,
but like a green leaf the righteous will flourish.
He who brings trouble \add to\add* his household, he will inherit wind,\f + \fr 11:29 \ft Or “breath, spirit” \f*
and a fool will serve the wise of heart.
The fruit of righteousness is a tree of life,
and he who captures souls\f + \fr 11:30 \ft Or “persons,” or “inner selves” \f* \add is\add* wise.
If the righteous on earth will be repaid,
⸤how much more⸥\f + \fr 11:31 \ft Literally “more for” \f* the wicked and sinner.
